Package main.java.model

Interface IModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Model
    public interface IModel
    This interface represents model part of the MVC architecture for the portfolio management system application. It provides features like creating a portfolio, getting all portfolios, loading a portfolio, viewing portfolio compositions.

    • Method Detail

      • executeStrategy

        java.lang.String executeStrategy​(int portfolioIndex,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> stockAndWeights,
                                 java.lang.Double investmentAmount,
                                 java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                 java.time.LocalDate endDate,
                                 java.lang.Double commission,
                                 int frequency)
                          throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        A method to execute a strategy on any given portfolio.

        This is a common method which can be used to execute dollar cost averaging as well as executing a strategy(weighted) on a specific date. In case it needs to be executed only for a specific date start and end date would be same.

        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - portfolioIndex for which the strategy needs to be executed.
        stockAndWeights - stockWeights that should be used for investing while executing the strategy.
        investmentAmount - amount that needs to be invested in the current strategy.
        startDate - startDate from which the strategy execution should start.
        endDate - endDate until which the strategy should be executed.
        commission - commission that should be used to execute the transactions mentioned in the strategy.
        frequency - frequency on how often the investment should be made according to the stocks and there weights provided.
        Returns:
        response string on whether the strategy was executed successfully or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If the arguments passed to the method are invalid. 2. If the strategy cannot be executed for the given dates.

      • createInflexiblePortfolio

        void createInflexiblePortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> stocks)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method creates an inflexible portfolio for the user and persists it in the application.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The portfolioName that should be assigned to the portfolio.
        stocks - A list Strings where each string contains the stockName/symbol, the quantity associated with the stock and date at which it was purchased.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.if an exception is occurred while storing the portfolio in the application. 2.If the arguments provided to the method are invalid.

      • createFlexiblePortfolio

        int createFlexiblePortfolio​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method creates a flexible portfolio for the user and persists it in the application.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - The portfolioName that should be assigned to the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the index of the portfolio in the portfolioList, after its creation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the portfolioName passed to the method is invalid.

      • getPortfolioValueOnDate

        StockPriceResponseWrapper getPortfolioValueOnDate​(int portfolioIndex,
                                                  java.time.LocalDate date)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value of the portfolio on a particular given date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - portfolioIndex for which the portfolio value needs to be displayed for the given date
        date - date for which the portfolio value needs to be displayed.
        Returns:
        StockPriceResponseWrapper object which internally has two list:- 1.List of Successful stock records for which price was fetched successfully. 2.List of unsuccessful records for which the price fetching failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments passed to the method are invalid.

      • getAllPortfolios

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllPortfolios()
        This method provides all the portfolios that are currently persisted in the application.
        Returns:
        List of formatted strings, wherein each string represent a portfolio and its date of creation.

      • isValidPortfolioName

        java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> isValidPortfolioName()
        A method to validate whether a given portfolio name is valid or not.

        It does two kinds of validations:- 1.The portfolio name should not be already present in the application. 2.The name cannot be an empty string. It only allows alpha Numeric characters(A-Z 0-9) and spaces in between the letters.

        Returns:
        a predicate object which can be used to test user input by the controller whether a given portfolio name is valid or invalid.

      • validateStockNameSymbol

        java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> validateStockNameSymbol()
        A method to validate whether a given String is a valid stockName or stockSymbol.

        The given string is validated against the supported list of stocks(masterList). The predicate returns true if it matches to any of the supported stocks name or the stock symbol. The predicate returns false if it does not matches neither stock name nor stock symbol for any of the supported stock

        Returns:
        a predicate object which can be used to test user input by the controller ,whether a given stock Name/Symbol is valid or invalid.

      • loadFlexiblePortfolioFromFile

        java.lang.String loadFlexiblePortfolioFromFile​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                                               java.lang.String filePath)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A method to load a flexible portfolio from a user provided file.

        This method allows user to provide a file with a particular format on which the code will parse and get the portfolio name, stock Name, stock Quantity, transaction type and date on which transaction happened. In case the transaction is not consistent it notifies the user and doesn't consider the transaction.

        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio
        filePath - the file path of the file that is to be loaded
        Returns:
        The response(success/failure) after performing the load operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments passed to the method are invalid.

      • loadInFlexiblePortfolioFromFile

        java.lang.String loadInFlexiblePortfolioFromFile​(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        A method to load an inflexible portfolio from a user provided file.

        This method allows user to provide file with a particular format on which the code will parse and get the portfolio name, stock Name, stock Quantity, date on which transaction happened. In case the transaction is not consistent it notifies the user and doesn't consider the transaction

        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio
        Returns:
        The response(success/failure) after performing the load operation.

      • getPortfolioComposition

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPortfolioComposition​(int index,
                                                         java.time.LocalDate date)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method gives the composition of a given portfolio.

        A composition is basically how many stocks(quantity) of a particular company (ticker) are owned by a user. .

        Parameters:
        index - index of the portfolio for which the composition needs to be displayed.
        date - date at which the composition needs to be displayed.
        Returns:
        List of formatted strings, where each string represents a stock and its quantity present in the portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments passed to the method are invalid.

      • transactStock

        void transactStock​(int portfolioIndex,
                   java.lang.String stockSymbol,
                   java.lang.Double stockQty,
                   java.lang.String transactionType,
                   java.time.LocalDate transactionDate)
            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method is used to transact(buy/sell) a stock on a particular portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - portfolio index on which the transaction needs to be updated.
        stockSymbol - stockSymbol that needs to be transacted.
        stockQty - Quantity of the stock that needs to be transacted.
        transactionType - type of the transaction(buy/sell).
        transactionDate - date of the transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If the transaction is invalid or if it cannot co-exist with the previously mentioned transactions for a particular stock.

      • getCommission

        double getCommission()

      • setCommission

        void setCommission​(java.lang.Double commission)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method allows the user to configure a particular commission value in the application.
        Parameters:
        commission - value of the commission that needs to be configured in the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the commission passed is a negative invalid number.

      • getCostBasis

        double getCostBasis​(int portfolioIndex,
                    java.time.LocalDate date)
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method allows us to return the cost basis on a portfolio until a date specified by the user.

        For a given set of transactions, it would basically calculate the buy order until the day which user specifies. If there are no transactions the cost basis is zero. It will also consider all the commissions which where paid by the user for all the previous transactions.

        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - the index of a portfolio that is to be selected
        date - the date on which the cost basis is required
        Returns:
        the cost basis of the portfolio
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If some error occurred while fetching the price of stock on a particular date. 2.If the arguments passed to the method are invalid.

      • fetchGraphData

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> fetchGraphData​(int portfolioNumber,
                                                java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                                java.time.LocalDate endDate)
        A method allows us to get graph data that needs to displayed in the application.

        This method takes the portfolio number and two dates,and groups them by the a particular scale(weeks/months/years) between the two user given dates. It only displays between 5-30 lines and the maximum price would 50 asterisks and rest prices would be normalized according to the maximum price

        Parameters:
        portfolioNumber - the number of the portfolio for which graph data is to be fetched
        startDate - the start date for the graph
        endDate - the end date for the graph
        Returns:
        List of string to display the graph data.

      • rebalancePortfolio

        void rebalancePortfolio​(int portfolioIndex,
                        java.time.LocalDate date,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> percentMap)
                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method allows the user to rebalance the portfolio on a given date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - the index of the portfolio that is to be rebalanced.
        date - the date on which the portfolio is to be rebalanced.
        percentMap - the percent map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when the code comes across a run time exception.
